853812471:
[

Protection & Control Engineer

Company Name Jemena Company Location Melbourne CBD

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 119 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
  • Melbourne CBD Based

About us

Jemena owns and operates significant gas, electricity and water transportation assets across Australia’s east coast, supplying millions of households and businesses with essential services every day.

With more than a century’s experience and expertise in the utilities sector and our strong portfolio of important distribution and transmission assets, we are ready to make the most of opportunities for growth and innovation.

As a provider of gas, electricity and water, we have enduring relationships with our customers and the communities where we operate. They are at the heart of our commitment to deliver energy and water safely, reliably and affordably, and to the sustainable growth of our business in the long term.

About the opportunity

Jemena is currently recruiting for a Protection and Control Engineer to join our Asset Management Team. Reporting into the Secondary Plant Manager, this role is primarily responsible for optimising the performance of protection, control, metering and monitoring equipment within the electricity distribution networks under the operational management of Jemena.

Key responsibilities also include but are not limited to:

  • Develop protection & control standards and policies for plant, applications, material and services, including preventative measures.
  • Perform engineering assessments for new plant and applications, condition monitoring for existing plant and failure investigations for failed plant.
  • Plan for the asset management of all electric network plant and applications.
  • Develop and gain approval of maintenance, replacement and augmentation strategies and projects.
  • Develop and maintain Maintenance Engineering documents and perform associated activities.

What we’re looking for

To be considered for this position you will possess the following:

  • Possess an electrical engineering qualification, coupled with current membership of the Institute of Engineers Australia.
  • Demonstrated experience in the strategic management and/or design of Protection & control systems.
  • A good understanding of protection and control, metering, monitoring, power quality, DC supply systems, substation and distribution automation, SCADA and communication as applied to the sub-transmission and distribution of electricity.
  • Understanding of the regulatory environment both technical and economic coupled with strong understanding of IEC61850 Standard
  • Project management skills, as well as financial pricing and cost analysis skills.
  • Highly developed verbal, written and interpersonal communications skills.

To apply: please submit a Cover Letter and CV

Applications close: Friday, 14th of September at 11.59pm

Jemena is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

Jemena is a dynamic company that focuses on attracting and motivating talented industry professionals. We’ve made it our priority to create an exceptional workplace with competitive salaries, educational assistance and salary packaging options, among other benefits.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Utilities

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering

[

Vendor Replenishment Planner

Company Name Lion Company Location Docklands, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 132 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


In an industry so competitive, we stand out by being different. By encouraging our teams to think differently, we're finding new ways to make a genuine connection with our customers.

We have an opportunity for a Vendor Replenishment Planner (VRP) to join the Lion Dairy & Drinks Integrated Business Planning (IBP) team based in our Docklands office.

You will be part of a team that provides the pivotal link between Coles and Lion's Integrated Business Planning teams and will monitor and manage stock levels and replenishment of Lion's Dairy products to all Coles Distribution Centre's (DC's) whilst providing Coles with exceptional service.

This fast paced role will see you as the conduit between Coles and a number of Lion internal stakeholders such as Logistics, Demand/ Supply Planning, & Sales to ensure we get our forecasting, ordering and delivery right to Coles every time. Solid relationship management and hitting our KPI's are key as you will be the Lion point of contact for the customer when challenges arise.

To be successful in the role, you will be calm under pressure and effectively able to problem solve and communicate. Strong analytical skills are essential, coupled with intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel. The ideal candidate would have a well-developed knowledge of supply chain planning, inventory management, replenishment, and experience working with a diverse group of stakeholders. In addition, you thrive in a collaborative team culture where you are encouraged to develop and grow your career in a customer centric environment.

Hours of work will typically be from 7am-3.30pm and you will be onsite at Coles Head Office Tooronga once a fortnight.

Knowing you're connected to our purpose is important to us. Connecting to our customers isn't meaningful unless it's genuine and with this in mind, we invest in building and nurturing customer relationships that last a lifetime.

Empower yourself to be part of this purpose - start a conversation with us today.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Food & Beverages

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Strategy/Planning
  • Supply Chain

853076327:
[

React Developer

Company Name Publicis.Sapient Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 76 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

The future is infinitely wide and begging to be reimagined and SapientRazorfish is looking for people who have the courage to make their dent in what has always been. If you have an optimism that says there is no limit to what we can achieve in a time inviting those with vision to shake things up, then we should talk. Our work is fueled by connected thinking, challenging boundaries, and the power of digital redefining a connected world. Our people thrive because of the belief that it’s both our privilege and responsibility to usher our clients and the world into what is next. We’re seeking those who question the status quo and want to reimagine the way the world works while realizing a smarter way for business to help – all in service of improving the daily lives of people, the world, your career. Next_reimagined.

React Developer
You’ll be an enthusiastic, “on the tools” React developer, looking to take the hard fought experience you’ve already got and apply it to new challenges. You will have the support and guidance of our national team, but be able to work independently when required.

You’re someone that strives to make an impact, as you’ll be a key member of our growing Melbourne team. You have a passion for the web and understand the unique possibilities involved in bringing web projects to life.

You’ll be comfortable prototyping concepts, iterating ideas and testing hypothesis to build products that people really want to use. Along the way, you’ll be looking for ways to pass along best practice and lessons learnt to colleagues. You’ll have your own opinions on approaches to technical problems and be able to articulate the tradeoffs that matter.

Key Roles And Responsibilities
  • Working as part of our Experience Design team, you’ll be working alongside Visual Designers, User Experience and Technology specialists to build and maintain Responsive websites and applications with standards compliant, performant and accessible HTML, CSS and JS.
  • Development of reliable and maintainable components while minimising technical debt.
  • Development of applications and their integration with back-end services.
  • Work alongside other engineers and developers working across different layers.
  • Develop solutions to solve business and technical problems and contribute with suggestions when technological limitations are discovered.
  • Define and implement creative solutions for rich user experience.
  • Delivering Front End technical guidance across the business. This might be the feasibility of a feature to our UX team, or an estimate of how long a feature would take to implement to a project manager.
  • Maintaining leading-edge knowledge in emerging technologies; drive knowledge-sharing and lessons-learnt sessions from project experiences.

Experience/Knowledge
  • You’ll have at least four years of commercial experience in modern web technologies (HTML5, CSS and JS) ideally at digital agency, product, consulting practice.
  • Strong knowledge of UI development best practice and SPA's.
  • Commercial experience using React + Redux using ES6 (at least 2 years).
  • Experience in developing applications using responsive web design.
  • Good understanding of WCAG accessibility requirements.
  • Experience with JavaScript unit testing frameworks such as Jest and Enzyme.
  • Experience using type-checking languages (Flow or Typescript) and CSS-in-JS libraries is a plus.
  • You’ll have worked on large web sites or applications, and ideally understand some of the challenges in building robust interfaces for content driven CMS driven web properties (Drupal, Sitecore, AEM etc.).
  • You have a solid understanding of how ‘the back end’ works and understand the role of a framework like Node.js or a language like Java. If you’ve got experience with building things on the back-end (APIs, services etc.) even better.
  • You have some familiarity with cross-cutting concerns in web development, such as security, performance, accessibility etc.
  • Exposure to, or an interest in, agile delivery methodologies would be useful.

About SapientRazorfish

SapientRazorfish is a new breed of transformation partner designed to help companies reimagine their businesses for the connected world. With more than 12,000 people and 70 offices around the globe, our capabilities span growth and business model strategy, new product and service innovation, customer experience, enterprise digital transformation, IT modernization, omni-channel commerce, precision marketing, change management, digital operations, digital innovation, data strategy and advanced analytics.

Job description

About Us

We are currently seeking a talented Maintenance Coordinator at our Meat Processing Plant to play a vital part in the progressive growth of this business.

This role is challenging, autonomous and calls for someone with more than just a trade background.

As Maintenance Coordinator you will be responsible for the controlling of stock from quotes, orders, and maintaining stock levels, you will also be the preventative maintenance program keeper and the facilities and services controller.

A small team of skilled and experienced personnel will assist you with your daily workload through a direct reporting relationship with you and the Engineering Manager for daily task allocations. It is vital that work is scheduled and undertaken in such a manner that allows for maximum operational productivity balanced against cost effciency whilst continually looking for ways to collaboratively improve upon exsisting practice.

Key activities-
  • Maintain food manufacturing stock and equipment orders to ensure production targets are achieved
  • Monitor and control costs, usage and orders based on production requirements
  • Liaise with various levels of Leadership, Support and Production teams on preventative and maintenance
  • Control and organise all ground maintenance, amenities plumbing and cleaning, roads, carpark and outside lighting, general cleaning of outside buildin, air conditioning, and lunch areas.
  • Ensure that all Safe working procedures are adhered to
  • Procurement functions including cost control, invoicing credit notes and sourcing alternative suppliers if required.
To be considered for this role applicants need to be able to meet the following selection criteria-
  • Experience in sourcing a large variety of machinery, spareparts and consumables needed to run FMCG operation
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft excell and word
  • Experience with CMMS systems
  • Good organisational skills
  • Self motivated, someone who can work unsupervised
#LI

If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!
